meanings.definition: A device that combines or separates signals on a single transmission line.
meanings.sent1: The diplexers helped merge the signals into one line.
meanings.sent2: Telecommunication systems often use diplexers to manage signals efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The diplexers at the party were great at mixing different music genres.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to multitask was like a set of diplexers, seamlessly juggling various tasks.
meanings.sent5: The diplexers acted like traffic controllers, directing signals to their designated paths.

meanings.definition: A component used in telecommunications to allow multiple signals to share the same transmission medium.
meanings.sent1: With diplexers, different signals can travel together through the same medium.
meanings.sent2: Telecommunication companies rely on diplexers for efficient signal sharing.
meanings.sent3: The diplexers at the meeting made sure everyone's voices were heard clearly.
meanings.sent4: In a world full of noise, diplexers are like harmony, blending signals seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The diplexers acted as mediators, ensuring fair access to the transmission medium.

meanings.definition: A device that enables the simultaneous transmission of two different frequencies on the same cable.
meanings.sent1: The diplexers allowed two frequencies to travel together on a single cable.
meanings.sent2: Modern technology uses diplexers to send multiple frequencies through one cable.
meanings.sent3: The diplexers in the experiment made the cable feel like a busy highway.
meanings.sent4: Like a magician's wand, diplexers made the impossible possible by uniting frequencies.
meanings.sent5: The diplexers were like translators, ensuring both frequencies could communicate effectively.
